SENT.plain: We report a case of agenesis of the internal carotid artery which was revealed by a subarachnoid hemorrhage
Angiography showed a ruptured aneurysm of the anterior communicating artery and unilateral absence of the left internal carotid artery
Both the left anterior and middle cerebral arteries were perfused from the right carotid artery via the anterior communicating artery
Absence of the left carotid canal was proved on bone CT
An hemodynamic stress on a congenital defect of the cerebral arterial wall could be the origin of the aneurysm development
